description:
You know the chicken is fresh here since they're always out of something, perpetually waiting on a restock from the fryer.  I order with loosely held aspirations (e.g. 4-piece Spicy) but let the fate of the fryer decide my order.  As long as a breast and wing are in the mix, I'm fine with whatever flavors and pieces destiny has chosen for me.

4-Piece: This is why you come here.  There is *no* fast food joint with better fried chicken.  Additionally, many fancy fried chicken restaurants with table service rarely live up to Popeye's.  And if they do happen to be better, they are usually 3x - 5x more expensive!  Something about Popeye's super crispy batter and tender chicken underneath.  If you're lucky enough to have the Spicy pieces be ready when you order, you can really appreciate that extended marinating.

Biscuit: A must for any chicken meal.  Super flaky.  A tad buttery, but not overly so.  Though one is all I really need to satiate me.

Red Beans & Rice: I get so focused on the chicken and biscuits, I often forget about their sides.  But these beans are really good.  So smoky and creamy.  With just a dollop of rice to add some firm texture.
author: Adam B.

description:
I rarely review a fast food place, because it's normally fast, and you know what your getting in terms of taste and quality.

As usual, the smell of fried chicken filled up our car as we passed by and we HAD to have a taste.

Luckily found parking and walked over. There was a pretty long line. I wasn't sure why it wasn't moving fast but paid no attention as there was a tv playing football, and I noticed they didn't run out of chicken, there were plenty at the pass.

10 minutes later, still waiting in line, the lady in front of me is having card issues, and it still trying to figure out her credit card. Not sure if it was some type of fraudulent purchase, but I didn't mind waiting because I was soooo hungry.

Finally their taking my order, and I realize they put a new trainee at the register....why? I also didn't mind, but the manager looked annoyed when he would ask her how to put in the order. It looked like she was busy making post mate orders.

After I FINALLY PLACED MY ORDER, I stood to the side, where about 10 people were standing also waiting for their order. I stood there confused. There was a ton of chicken at the pass, and 2 people preparing the boxes. But NOTHING WAS GETTING SENT OUT. I kept seeing fresh chicken being put at the pass but the workers weren't grabbing it to hand out orders. The cooks were doing something right, but the people executing the orders were soooo slowwww. I sat back down because I had a feeling it was going to be awhile.they were just staring at the chicken. I wasn't sure what was going on. I didn't ask but I just wanted to hop over and get my food myself.

After waiting another 15 minutes for my order, the new shift employees arrived. But the pace didn't change. A couple of guys came in from post mates and they got their orders first. Granted, they still had to wait 10 minutes, but they still got their food before we did.

About another 10 minutes later, we finally got our order. We hungrily ste it and was so disappointed! The chicken was so dry by the time we got it. They weren't moving fast enough to move the product. 

Definitely the worst Popeyes I've ever been to. Not the place to order from. You're better off going to a different location.
author: Lynn C.

description:
#7: x5 fried chicken strips + 1 side +1 biscuit = 11.75
$10 meal deal: x5 fried chicken strips + 2 sides + 2 biscuits = 10.86
#math #facts
and this is in SF where every sandwich is $12-14
author: Jeremy H.

description: Never ever order Popeyes through a delivery app. They will give you the smallest pieces of chicken. I ordered a 5 piece and the gave me 3 legs a breast and a wing. Total garbage, always go in person.
author: Larry S.

description:
Make sure to double check your order. I ordered the 4PC chicken tenders but instead got 2 drumsticks and 2 chicken breasts. Not too big a deal, but just make sure you get what you asked for.

The chicken itself was okay. The drumsticks were really small, but tender and moist. The chicken breasts, on the other hand, were really dry. Not up to par at all. I was quite disappointed. 

On the bright side, the Mac n cheese side was good and not mushy at all. The biscuit was flavored well too. But overall I expected better of the main course (chicken).
author: Karen Y.

description:
SO... yesterday was my first time EVER trying Popeyes. Came to this location with a friend. First thing I noticed was how clean it was! The interior isn't anything special, but hey its a fast food joint, so I don't expect beautiful or fancy at all.

I ordered the two piece chicken combo $7.35. You pick a side (I chose cajun fries) and it comes with a biscuit too. The chicken was crispy oily goodness. Cajun fries were good.. I've had better, but considering this is a fast food, it's decent. ALSO, the workers behind the counter were really nice.
author: Debby N.

description:
Decent Popeyes in SF. The cashier, a trainee, was very sweet and versed in the menu options and combos trying to point out a higher volume option for cheaper. They were efficient and got the order right. The place itself is really clean and has a Coke Freestyle machine.

I've got a soft spot for the Popeye's breading on the Spicy fried chicken. I've had better Popeyes with fresher chicken in the South Bay (back in Waffle Tenders day) but this is the Popeyes to hit up SF.
author: Truc N.

description:
I love Popeyes, but this spot AIN'T POPEYES. Maybe it was the batch I got, but when I bit into my chicken from my three piece chicken combo, it was NOT LIT. First of all, the breading was bland. It didn't have that SIGNATURE DELICIOUS MOUTHSMACKING POPEYES TASTE that keeps me coming to Popeyes and not KFC. Not all the spices seemed to be there... Then, the white meat itself WASN'T JUICY like it's supposed to be. It was DRY, which made me very sad because I was really looking forward to some delicious and juicy Popeyes Chicken. The fries and biscuit were lit as usual tho.

This Popeyes left me confused cuz now I don't know whether I should try another Popeyes store or just get KFC next time for my fried chicken fix. Maybe I just got a bad batch, or maybe Popeyes just ain't as good as I remembered it to be.
author: Edward L.

description:
Never order delivery from this place, through any apps or websites, if you are hoping or expecting to actually be enjoying the delicious,  juicy chicken within 2 hours of ordering it...or even AT ALL the same day. I ordered from this Popeyes location, through Grubhub, earlier this evening at 7:30pm...and even left a tip on top of the $5 delivery charge upon ordering (which is a practice I'm very much considering no longer doing when ordering delivery because of this experience). I place my order at 7:30pm,  then patiently wait until 8:45pm before contacting the restaurant to inquire about where it is, since it was quoted to reach me within 55 minutes of ordering it. To my surprise, the order hadn't even left the restaurant...and furthermore,  the manager says the driver won't even be around to pick it up until about 9:10pm. They quickly ask if I just want to cancel the order, to which I tell them not to. But when I get off of the phone with them, I contact Grubhub to see if they have any sort of influence on getting more information from the restaurant on how it's taking so long to get my order out of the door. While on the phone with Grubhub customer service, speaking with a representative,  I receive a text on my phone saying that my order has been canceled. Mind you, the restaurant is open until 10pm...so what reason would they have to cancel an order otherwise, especially after told not to. The Grubhub representative calls them to figure out what's taking them nearly two hours to deliver the order...and the manager lies and tells him that I called and told them to cancel it. He even tells them that he's sure I was just calling to find out what the hold up was, and they still refuse to have the order delivered.
And for the cherry on top, this will make the second time in a row that something very similar to this situation has happened to me when ordering delivery from this Popeyes location.
I place an order
The order is received
The order is made (?)
I wait over an hour
I inquire, just to find out it hasn't even left the premises.
Last time the business closed before I could inquire about my order.

Moral of the story, if you order delivery from here...you'll spend money to wait over an hour, and still end up starving after waiting...with no food on the way
author: U. Sacred M.

description:
You can never go wrong!! This place is delicious and the food is always hot! 

Their fries and coke slaw are to die for!
author: Idalia G.

description: The chicken I had here was good. Tender on the inside and the outside was crispy. The red beans was good too! I don't have much to say about the service, it was okay and as for the place it was nice and clean.
author: Brenda L.

description:
Very clean for a fast food restaurant (let alone San Francisco), nice interior decor, and the girls who work behind the counter are very nice, esp. compared to Fillmore Popeye's.

Very friendly staff, I can't emphasise that enough. That in SF is easily worth 5 stars.
author: Stevie D.

description: Sometimes I come here to get my friiieeed chicken fix! The chicken is good and I really like their fries. Tried the fried shrimp once and it was decent. If you intend to eat in, the tables were clean every time I was there. Parking in the area may be a hassle but if you're taking public transit, there are a couple of muni stops a few steps away.
author: Ric L.

description:
Many reviewers have noted how clean this place is, and they're right. The tables and floors have always appeared clean whenever I've visited.  And the chicken is good--juicy and delicious.

But on two occasions I've ordered 12 chicken thighs--and paid extra for them--and brought home a box of chicken containing LEGS, BREASTS and WINGS!

Admittedly, you get more meat on a breast than a thigh, but I prefer dark meat to white.  And you get far LESS meat on a leg--and especially on a wing--than you do on a thigh.  On top of that: If you're going to be charged EXTRA for a "special order," then YOU SHOULD GET WHAT YOU PAY FOR.

The second time this happened, I went back the same night (although this meant another lengthy bus ride from my home). The original box had contained: THREE thighs, THREE breasts, THREE legs and THREE wings--NOT TWELVE THIGHS. And I brought its evidence with me, along with the slip of my order.

Not getting what I had paid for was bad enough. But what REALLY infuriated me was the reaction of the store manager.  According to  him, it ISN'T enough to clearly give your order to the cashier who is supposed to write it up.  Apparently, to make sure they get it right, you need to give it TO AT LEAST ONE OTHER PERSON there.  

He didn't say just WHICH person you're supposed to give it to.

In short: If YOU CLEARLY TELL the cashier WHAT YOU WANT, it's YOUR FAULT WHEN THEY REPEATEDLY GIVE YOU WHAT YOU DIDN'T ASK FOR.

This ISN'T how a successful business is supposed to run.  And when CUSTOMERS are blamed for the CARELESSNESS of employees, word gets around.  Like on this page.

My advice: If you order chicken to take out, GO THROUGH THE BOX BEFORE YOU LEAVE THE STORE to make certain you've gotten what you paid for.
author: Rodolfo F.

description:
Haven't a clue how this location can justify keeping its doors open. Usually when I pass by, there's no sign of life, except when they have advertised a special.  Reading some older reviews here, apparently this site was remodeled in the recent past.  I can only imagine what it use to look like...

The inside is basic, the atmosphere, tables, seating are bare bones and uninviting, not particularly comfortable or beckoning--if that's what they were goin' for, to accelerate turnover, they succeeded. When it is busy, a line forms down the center, from the counter to the front door, which makes for chaos for those already seated and those waiting on their order. Clearly no one gave much thought to customer flow in the remodel, or didn't care. If they hired an interior designer for the remodel, that person should be shown the door.

Not to invoke a stereotype, but the employees are "fast food", they are there to do a mechanical task, they lend nothing positive to the experience. The register experience is underwhelming, whether or not to charge for a bag seems to dominate the limited exchange.  Homeless population has an impact here.

I like the chicken, but it's overpriced except when they have a promotion.  There's nothing about this physical location or the employees, however, that make me want to return, except when I get a craving for that chicken, which is becoming less and less...

Whoever has this franchise location, I doubt it's goin' add much to their retirement.
author: Steve M.

description: Love this location after it was remodel they have kept it clean not dirty no dust on tables they're always cleaning but most importantly the food is always fresh they always make a fresh batch the staff is so friendly so nice they even let me call in my order so I don't have to wait in line.
author: Michele T.

description: My favorite 'fast food' dive;buy the all you can drink beverage+any chicken meal+alway buy the red beans/rice(it seems to keep me satiated all day) ;you can also just buy a thigh a la carte(don't have to buy an entire meal), or buy a $$cold brew coffee (across the street@BI-rite),& use the Popeye's ice machine(perfect restaurant if you have business at the DMV on Fell street.. ..)
author: Jeffrey W.

description:
I swore I wrote a review for the first Popeye's restaurant in San Francisco. "Oh well!"

Nevertheless, I have been to this corner Popeye's location many times and enjoyed eating the Fried Chicken here for a quick meal or grabbing a double-digit amount of pieces to take home or to parties. 

But this is my first visit since the remodel a few months back. They have added bright lights, two flat screen televisions and a Coke machine similar to Five Guy's. So far, so good!

My recent visit to the newly renovated restaurant, I was daring enough to try the "Ghost Pepper" wings. You need to wait five minutes for the wings to cook, which is good and noticeably fresh. For $3.99, the meal comes with one biscuit and six of the spiciest wings blended with lethal spices. Do not let the name scare you. The wings were indeed spicy, but tolerable enough for wimps like me. Despite not selling milk, it was a good thing the soda machine was close by to extinguish the flaming wings.

The restaurant is enchanting now with the facelift. 

Credit cards are accepted.
author: Matt G.

description:
A few months ago some local media reported that this Popeyes is closing down. Well, instead of closing down, they renovated it and reopened! 

The new store is clean and comfortable to sit in. This is probably my favorite cheap chicken spot in town right now.

Occasionally you'll get homeless people wandering in asking for food. So it wouldn't be a bad idea to order extra pieces so you can share with them.
author: Joseph L.

description:
This Popeye's was probably the cleanest chain restaurant I've ever been to.

The reason why this is getting a 3-star from me was the service. My friend and I came here and got the exact same order. He received his within 5 minutes and I had to wait about 10 minutes for mine.

Apparently they didn't cook our nuggets together which I don't understand why they couldn't put a batch since our orders were consecutive.

The food was great. It was what I expected it to taste like. I usually get my chicken nuggets with the bayou buffalo sauce.

My favorite part about Popeye's is their French fries with Cajun seasoning. So good!
author: Aj C.

description:
Service could sometimes be slow but they were always friendly. I like coming to this spot better than the one in the plaza near Safeway in Japantown. Tuesdays are the days my mom loves to come so we swing by every so often to grab dinner for her. $13 for 11 pieces (half spicy, half mild) is a good price, but I think the sides are a bit overpriced. A regular bowl of mash is a little less than $3, but the large which is barely larger is around $6. The spicy and mild are barely spicy so I don't mind either. I like enjoying my fried chicken with the sour-y spicy sauce packets they have.

FYI - parking is not easy here.
author: Amanda C.

description:
You get what you pay for. Most of the time, the food is just fine. I only ever came to Popeyes when Mr. Joy had fried chicken cravings. It's not easy to find parking, so usually I would order takeout inside while he circled the block, and then we'd be on our way. Something about this location just does not give off a good vibe, or a good smell. It just does not say come in, relax, eat & be merry! Even for fast food, it's dingy.
The service is fine, but slow. The place is usually quite dead, with just a handful of people ordering. Still they seem so understaffed. I don't know how many people are responsible for making the food, but I've only ever witnessed one cashier person diligently putting all the orders together.
The food's not bad. I always like buttery, greasy biscuits. The red beans & rice are good too. Cajun fries are Mr. Joy's jam. I actually think the chicken could be better. Sure the seasoning is alright and the skin is crispy, but there's not that much meat. Some bites were just crunchy batter on bone. Like I said, you get what you pay for.
author: Joy W.

description: I love Popeyes but despite what the health rating on yelp says, this place JUST had a vermin infestation so I can't eat here. Such a bummer that these places don't care about cleanliness or the health of their employees and customers.
author: Emma M.

description: Love the 1.99 Tuesday's special (thigh and leg). We came in around 10:30am without having to wait long. We ordered 45 orders (note: each person can only order the max of 20 orders) equals 90pieces of chicken, this came out to 89.55, not including tax! Chicken came out very moist, the skin was crunchy to my bite! The counter people was nice but is a bit stingy with the utensils and plates.
author: April N.

description:
They really need to get rid of that stale air in the shop that's like leftover homeless stench. It's just not classy for a fast food chain that has such a prime location right by Bi-Rite and Alamo Square Park. It was pretty dead inside with only a couple of tables eating there. Either most people get it to go or it's just not very popular.

Dropped by for a snack -- spicy chicken drumstick and a biscuit for $2.09 ($2.27 after tax). The batter on the outside of the chicken was pretty awesome - very crispy with a slight spice, but not too spicy. However, it was a bit dry on the ends of the chicken, which leads me to wonder just how long they had been sitting out. I was there around noon on a Sunday, so I would think that turnover should be pretty high around then. 

The biscuit was not as fluffy as others (like in KFC), but it was still warm and quite fresh. They had both jam and butter to go with it. I didn't really enjoy the butter, but I guess I couldn't really expect too much. 

If you really are craving fried chicken though, definitely go with the spicy at Popeyes!
author: Audrey L.

description:
This is one of the better Popeyes Ive been to as far as being organized through the chaos of the mad limes they have sometimes and boy do they keep this place clean. 

As for the food. Well what can I say. Its so much better then KFC I wish they had more Popeyes locations around. I just luv the skin and juiciness of their chicken. The little cravers pack is delicious. They also do popcorn and butterfly shrimp just right.

The only downside is Im not a fan of their fries. On Tuesday's they have a great special 2 pieces for $1.49 and its jam packed in here. Lines out the door. 

Parking in the area sucks to high hell though.
author: T C.

description:
I  would love to rate it higher but I don't think so! Yesterday, My boyfriend and I had orderd some chicken with Red Beans &Rice yesterday for Father's Day. The chicken wasn't done all the way, plus the Beans&Rice had a tangy taste like it was old,taste like its been sitting up for days . We will not be coming back to 
this location. We had thrown  our beans & rice away because it made our stomach twist and turn.
   If anything, go to Popeyes in Fillmore. They're way better.
author: Bernie F.

description: This popeyes chicken picks up the phone and says we are open today. This joint was closed last night. Sometimes its really weird that its closed. But the chicken is delicious and good. Tuesday special is 1.99 or was it 2.29 for 2 pieces. The staff is nice to talk to. Good spicy chicken. You gotta love the breading.
author: Harry L.

description:
Hey. Here's a long awaited shout out.  I am giving the Divis. location 5 stars because they are the Badass of Popeye's. When my co-workers or I can do a run...we all make that face when asked. That grinning, greasy fried chicken sounds good face. And they always say... Ur going to Divis? 

Actually, they serve up the least greasiest of the chain and their oil has always been clean. 

The location stinks and there's always drama going on, but the chicken, biscuits and red beans/rice are killer. The staff are always on their toes and they are really nice. Well, they have to be to survive. Personally, I would not go here on a Tuesday special. I do not think I could handle it.
author: Evelyn K.

description:
The staff here is great.  Super friendly despite the seemingly endless stream of rude garbage-type people that comes through here. The place is super clean and they have a 100 health score! 

Myself and some friends woke up with a hangover after a night of cards and drinking heavily. We scoured yelp only to find every fried chicken place nearby was closed and Popeyes was on our way to the haight. My brother got a small wing in his meal, I joked "just take it back,  they probably deal with trashy people like that all the time." Two seconds later some woman comes in and makes a huge fuss for the entirety of our meal making a fool of her damn self.  She sent her kids to get food for her.  Her son ordered the wrong meal and she comes in after to make a stink about it, not sure exactly what she was complaining about.  Then other customers start chiming in. Like,  people!  stfu are you serious? Mind ya bizness.  

Hilariously enough,  my friend who was standing in line came back to the table and said the whole thing started because she got a small wing!  Hahaha i totally called it. 

Anyway,  the staff was somehow really nice and they gave us cooled wetnaps from the fridge after our meal.  Thanks guys!
author: Kait A.

description: Twice in less then 6 months ive caught them charging more then the advertised prices. I had to file a complaint with corporate and im bot wven wastingnmy time this 2nd time. When i brought it to their attention that i was over charged for my meal all 3 employees upfront just had a dazed look on their face and all they could say was "oh we'll let our boss know". No apology no attempt to refund me (wasnt worth making a hassle over 22 cents).  Buyers beware
author: Kody S.

description: I felt Compelled to write this review since it was online where I read Popeyes had terrific red beans and rice.....so I went in to try it out for myself.  Terrific...not exactly....the rice wasn't cooked right and the red beans score a 4 out of 10 at best.  The cost....$5 for the large which was still pretty small.  I get fantabulous beans and rice from a hole in the wall Hispanic restaurant near where I work for $4 and its three times more than what I was served....So Popeyes for beans and rice = less food + more money +less quality.  When you walk into a restaurant and there are too many employees....RUN OUT OF THERE.
author: Daniel B.

description:
Always get your chicken spicy.

Popeyes is legendary for me because I live 4 doors down from it. At 10am they start pumping delicious poultry smell into the neighborhood and that gets me salivating. By the time it's lunch I'm just trying to decide if I want the 2 piece bonafide or the 5 piece tenders.

Get the mashed potatoes or the Mac and cheese. Sweet tea rocks as well.

Despite pigeons and beggars flocking to this particular location, I must say I've had some great times here while waiting for food. I once made friends with a traveling parrot (I'm not sure if she also ate chicken, that would be weird) and I also drunkenly started a restaurant wide rendition of YG's Toot It and Boot It (oooooh whoa)
author: John N.

description:
Sad the kitchen burned down recently at this location, glad no one got hurt. Hopefully they'll be able to repair it and reopen this place soon.

Unlike the Fillmore location, the food consistency at this store is usually very good (see my pics). On the other hand service at the register was just okay.

The lack of parking doesn't affect foot traffic as much, because people like to frequent the few bars and restaurants in this area. An added benefit of this corner location is getting business from people who couldn't get into pricey and popular Nopa restaurant across the street.
author: Luis C.

description:
Ohhhhhh you little minx, luring me in with the $3.99 DIP 'n CHIKN deal at 9:58pm on a saturday night. OH BUT YOU DID NOT WANT TO MAKE ME ANY DIPNCHICKN THEN, DID YOU?

NO. 
So I had to buy "spicy strips" for 6.50. 
They gave me awful gas. 
Please don't feed the pigeons. 
Or me. 
Actually feed the pigeons before you feed me kthnx. 
Oh, and good luck getting some dip 'n chickn!

I am not bitter AT ALL.
author: Emily D.

description: Oh yeah, baby!  This has to be THE best Popeye's that I have ever been to.  It's very clean and the staff are friendly and energetic.  The service here is second to none.  And of course the food here blows all the other locations right out of the water.  The one Fillmore needs to take notes of how a Popeye's actually operates.
author: Alex W.

description: The service was ridiculously slow but the food is good. Disappointed with this location.
author: Shivani S.

description: This was a spot to go to back then. but I've notice new employees past couple of weeks and it's just too horrible of a service. Went in last week and the service was very slow but still had to wait 10min to get help. This time The lady just looks around makes you wait for no reason then she starts cleaning doing her other things. I've under stand if there's lots of customers but I've went in when its empty and they are playing very loud music over the speakers. I'm not sure but I think it's the same lady. O well I'll still give it a try on this location but when I see her I'll just walk out and try again the next day.
author: Anthony G.

description:
I'm not saying I moved to the neighborhood just so I could eat here... but it's sort of true. Wherever you live, you should have that guilty pleasure restaurant nearby. I'm talking about the "Excuse" restaurant. Whatever the excuse is ("I'm hungover, "I'm sad, "I had a bad day at work"), Popeyes satisfies. It's greasy, delicious, and has a outrageous discount on Tuesdays. 


No one is saying it's the next State Bird Provisions, but it makes me happy. 

PROTIP:

Get the chicken. Be friendly when you order, you just might get an extra bbq sauce for free.
author: Patrick T.

description: Well, no surprises here, it's all about the chicken. I've eaten here 4 times do not recommend the shrimp, tastes like spicy nothing.  The green beans are okay, a little spicy also. You can only get cajun fries here and I thought they were way too spicy. You can get mild chicken and it's greasy and delicious. It's difficult to get extra napkins however. That being said on Tuesdays they have a leg and a thigh for $1.99 plus tax. There is a cool soda dispenser where you can get any kind of soda you can imagine,really high tech!
author: Kelly P.

description: Customer Service was ok, chicken was crispy and juicy, fries was a little soggy, and the bathroom was a little dirty and smelled but hey its a fast food restaurant so I cant complain.
author: Kevin K.

description:
If you are smart enough to realize that Popeye's does not aim to be a fine dining experience, you're going to F*cking love this chicken.

The first time I went in, there was an sf crazy trying to barter at the counter for half a cup of soda, another homeless person at one of the tables, and yes... there were 2 live pigeons (problem has since been taken care of, personally I miss the atmosphere the pigeons help foster).  

I decided to still go for it. When I finished my meal at home, and the grease was dribbling down my chin, I had the strong urge to walk back in and start a slow clap for the fine women who make this chicken happen.

If you possess the personal fortitude to stay past the initial atmospheric surprise, you will be heavily rewarded with perhaps the best fried chicken in a 50 mile radius. It gets to you piping hot, crispy, and insanely delicious. You might not want a lot of plans for the rest of the day though.

What a great motherfucking establishment.
author: Ian F.

description: Doesn't feel like you're going to an outdated chain restaurant- the interior is clean and bright and has some personal touches (spices in glass jars in the middle of the space). We had the 5 piece tender dinner and 4 piece chicken dinner. Service was quick. Food was A ok- hit the spot though the bone in chicken is definitely more flavorful than the boneless tenders.
author: J L.

description:
This Popeyes deserves five stars for being one of the original businesses on the block pre-gentrification, pre-NOMA.  As a youngin, my family would drive out to Divisadero (which was much rougher back in the day) and have one of us hop out of the car and grab some delicious fried chicken from Popeyes.  Another person would stay in the car with eyes toward the person buying the chicken to make sure no thugs were entering the store, doors locked and engine running, so that we could hurry out of the neighborhood as soon as we got our damn chicken!  

Glad you're still here, Popeyes.
author: Ernest S.

description:
I'll gladly pay you Tuesday for a hamburger today? Sorry Wimpy - it's Popeyes day...

I got my spicy 3 Piece & Biscuit - Leg, Wing & Thigh all for just 3.49 plus tax.

Fast friendly service, cheap, and Crispyspicilicious!...
author: Gary E.

description:
One of the best fast food restaurants to get fried chicken from. Their chicken comes original and spicy plus it is very delicious. Their fries and mashed potatoes are also delicious. These are one of the three combos I am going to order the next time I get food at Popeyes!

06/10/2014:
Onion rings are delicious - I believe this is like a new item or something. I'm definitely glad I made the decision to come in for this. If you're someone who enjoys having a little spice in your food, Popeyes is your answer. I like the flavoring of the food and the New Orleans spice kicks in. Overall, good experience here and a great spot to visit for a quick grub.
author: Bennett W.

description: Went to Popeyes after the Warriors won the first game in the finals and my favorite bruh let me sub my biscuit for red beans and rice and STILL get fries. Praise. Fried chicken always on point obvi.
author: Stephanie G.

description:
Cleanest Popeyes I've ever been to (and that says a lot if you live in San Francisco).

Seriously. My food was fresh. I didn't wait long. The cashier was nice. I didn't get harassed. I call that a good day!

I will keep coming back. I'm still amazed at how clean it was.....
author: Jennifer H.

description: Pleasant cashier, food was tasty, and service was timely.
author: Ace V.

description:
My partner and I decided to have Popeye's chicken tonight as our "Friday fun food."
I had a coupon for his restaurant for 10 pieces of chicken, two sides and five biscuits for $19.99.
While I placed the order, my partner searched for a parking space.  That took him about five minutes.
The restaurant didn't have five mild pieces of chicken ready, but the kitchen provided them quickly.  I wanted five pieces of spicy chicken and that was ready.
The two young ladies at the counter quickly assembled our order and I checked it before we left.
Once we got home, we realized that we were not told which pieces were spicy and which were mild so we had to taste the chicken to find out.  The red beans and rice was very good and the biscuits were hot and fresh.
So, the food was very good, but the service was mediocre.  The counter staff should have told us which pieces were mild and which were spicy.
author: Philip C.

description: In an ocean of restaurants in sf , I find this Popeyes to be an oasis for real good deep fried chicken. They just beat KFC hands down. I like it a lot.
author: Jorydude r.

description:
The one star isn't for the chicken, which is out of this world fabulous, but instead for the rude, unhelpful staff who work here. I am talking about the two girls who were working today. I didn't order any special, but rather the normal chicken and biscuits from the menu and asked for some chicken, some tenders. "No - you can't do that!" they immediately said. WTF? They do it at every other Popeye's - why the hell is your shitty store so different. I asked the other girl working and she said, "No, I won't do it for you." so I got the manager's name and I'll complain to her later. I can understand if it's a special deal, but this was the regular menu. Plus...NO CAJUN SPARKLE!!

Yeah, it's in a ghetto location, but that doesn't mean you have to BE ghetto yourself.

If you have a car, do yourself a favor and go to the one in Daly City by Target. It's cleaner, the chicken is better and the staff is nicer.
author: Liz C.

description:
This review is NSFW - just warning you in advance.  The chicken wrap here is fucking delicious.  It should be a Schedule I Controlled Substance - it is goddamn good.  The slab of chicken in it is so freaking huge it sticks out of the wrap about 3 inches.  An impressive amount of food for a buck 69.  The wrap i got at the Popeyes on Mission St. was shorter and just didn't have the same narcotic effect. 

It's a bit embarrasing walking in, in full view of the patrons at the upscale Nopa restaurant across the street.  It helps to remind myself that their costly meal of rabbit legs and head cheese isn't nearly as good as my wrap.

WTF is head cheese anyway.

The only reason for not giving 5 stars is because they sometimes put the wrong item in my bag, and they're slow as fuck.  But at least this place does have good people-watching potential.  One time this woman was ordering food wearing a hospital gown and a hospital bracelet.  Her gown was soaked at the bottom - apparently she didn't have bladder control.  I guess the food here is worth escaping from the hospital to get.  Anyway, an ambulance pulled up in a few minutes and the guy asked me if someone called for an ambulance.  I nodded over to the woman, and they took her away.  I kinda felt bad, because she didn't get to enjoy the chicken wrap.

I think they sell fried chicken here.  I haven't tried it.
author: J H.

description:
Well they have a multi-lingual staff.  Unfortunately the asian chick at the counter couldn't understand the hispanic guy making the food.  That meant I got the wrong flavor of pie for dessert.

Regardless the chicken was hot, greasy, and awesome.

Just like my favorite nude male revue.
author: Rocco B.

description: My absolute favorite side here is the beans and rice. Although ordering here in the city has its setbacks since the containers are smaller in comparison to the original styrofoam containers you get at locations outside the city. Obviously the chicken is also good, but unfortunately not always fresh so make sure you ask them to give you your pieces from the fresh batch. The crispiness and spice of the chicken are just perfect. On tuesdays enjoy two pieces for $1.30! Beats taco tuesdays!
author: M R.

description:
I was hungry new years eve....and I was desperate, Popeyes was open...and damm their chicken was the bomb. You have to wait while they fry it up....but it is fresh, hot and crispy.  The biscuit was great too.

The fries stink and cole slaw is terrible....but their chicken was really good....I AM BLOWN AWAY.

Last thing the lady that worked there, I think she was korean, was really great. I could tell she was very patient with the customers and was super pleasant.
author: David G.

description:
Whenever I feel the urge to eat fried chicken I always pick popeye's its just the best fried chicken out there.
From the skin to juiciness of the chicken and all of their sides are delicious.
I just wish they had more locations in the city.
And most of the time the service is spot on.
I would pick popeye's over kfc anytime.
author: Corey W.

description: I really don't even know what to write.  But ill start with the biscuits. They were better than my grandmas! Boy, really took me back and the chicken.. WOW! i think it was organic but I'm not sure. all i know is that when i cook fried chicken at home its not that good. Plus they have a serve yourself soda fountain. Thats great!! keep up the good work Mr. Popeye.
author: Louisa W.

description: Worst Popeyes or any food establishment for that matter. First service is slow. Like senior citizen, slug slow. With one cook and one girl at the counter, It took a least 15 minutes before I could make my order. So while being forced to wait(mind you an ape could press buttons on a cash register faster then the employees) I looked around and saw three full bags of trash laying on the floor next to a group of tables. Trash, filled with half eaten old food probably filled with all sorts of germs and bacteria on the floor next to where customers eat. No excuse for this behavior. Disgusting!!! Tables were not clean and to top it all off there were several homeless people just sitting in the restaurant with all there crap off the street. Gross!!!
author: Paulie E.

description: Hmmm never going back. Its all flour,oil oil oil and more oil oh plus sodium. Unhygienic. Friends kept pushing to try the chicken here claiming its to die for,lol. So glad I tried bc I would not step foot in there again. Feel like I need 3days detox. But I give it up to the super friendly workers there.
author: DeesQue N.

description:
As a request from a coworker, I had to pick up $125 worth of chicken here for her bday office lunch.  I called a few days prior, wrote up a list of stuff I wanted, the manager Juan even tried to find the best deal.  Tuesday morning, 11am we ended up in a line outside waiting for the doors to open.  Why did schedule this lunch on a Tuesday?  I had no idea Tues were so big in the Popeye's world.  Angry patrons knocked on the glass doors upset because they haven't opened up at 11:01am.  

They staff was on top of things, got everything perfectly and was very prompt and extremely nice.  

DON'T come here on a Tuesday if you aren't serious about your chicken.  You don't want to see the faces of those that are and are willing to wait in line prior to opening.  These people mean some serious chicken business and are extremely inpatient.
author: Rosalind S.

description:
So we're heading over to our friend's place to watch the Pacquiao/De La Hoya fight, and we wanted to get some Louisiana Fried Chicken to grub on. But wait...its not baseball season....better call to make sure they're still open. Damn it...they close at 7!!! Only 10 minutes to get there, still by GG Park, and they probably won't have freshly fried chicken. Commence plan B.....detour to Popeyes. 

We start to order, and the guy says..."sorry, you can't get that." Uhh...what? So we stare at him. And he keeps saying that we can't order that.... more staring. Finally, he tells us he's joking. Dude...don't joke about food...that's not funny! 

So we order the 16 piece bucket with 8 biscuits, mashed potatoes, mac n' cheese, two 9-piece nuggets, and a corn on the cob. And that was just for 5 of us...yes...we're pigs( http://static.px.yelp.com/bphoto/Uio8sj2goXcBMeUNsutvAg/l ). Homie was pretty cool though...he hooked it up with a bag full of sauces, and he even gave us the freshly fried chicken...not the stuff that's been sitting under the heat lamp.  Everything was good except for the corn on the cob...overcooked and mushy.  

Nothing better than some fried, greasy food and a beer......and then lots of wine....mmmm...mmmm....gooooood.

Oh yeah...and thanks to homie for hooking it up with the hot sauce....we got to watch our drunk friend slather his piece of chicken with 15 packets and slup up all the sauce.  http://static.px.yelp.com/bphoto/AZJoADgoMUs0q7-vOFDpzw/l  Good times!
author: Patra I.

description:
99 cent Tuesdays here is always entertaining as hell. Its probably the most fun i have while waiting in line for fast food.

One time i was in line before it opened and some 60 yr old triple o.g. hoodrat cuts everybody in line right when they open and claims she tried to make a phone order, so her disregard of the "first come, first served" system was totally justified. I was thinking to myself, "who the hell makes a phone order at Popeye's?" She then places about 15 orders and demands that they all be put in separate boxes, how classy. 

Another time, some girl apparently received a small ass piece of chicken so she threw her biscuit at the cashier's face. And it wasn't just any cashier, but the disgruntled Asian kid that seems to work there from open to close. Poor guy had pieces of biscuit all up in his eye brow and mustache. Gotta give it up to him though, he puts up with a lot of sh*t and keeps coming back for more.   

All in all, the fried chicken here is good, especially for $1. Sure you gotta wait in line for a bit, but occasionally stuff happens in line. Funny, interesting stuff. Before you know it you're in front of the line placing your 15 orders in separate boxes.
author: Kyle E.

description:
Wicked chicken box is a bargain at $3.99. Comes with seasoned fries (so awesome), Biscuits (always good), and the signature dish: Garlic Wicked Chicken. Perhaps a misnomer as it didn't the punch that Popeyes spicy chicken does but delicious nonetheless. Tasty white meat strips. Mildly peppered. Garlic is bit powdery and artificial bit the undercurrent is so mild nothing a little hot sauce won't fix. 

The Popeyes staff forgot to put in the tiny bottle of Tabasco sauce, which was sorely missed.
author: Quentin J.

description: I always love Popeye's.  This location has very good service (based on last Tuesday's visit, which is a day with the Tuesday two-piece special), and it's probably the most pleasant of the four San Francisco locations.
author: H K.

description: My first time here. Very crispy fried chicken. Order the spicy. Good Cajun rice but coleslaw too sweet.
author: May C.

description:
want to see a really dirty, grimey, greasy Popeyes that looks all nasty with some loser motherfuckers hanging out inside there and around the front.  then go there.  It sucks.  Nasty.  

Goddamn chicken corpse eaters.  you murderers!

Tis will make you say, "Take me back to New Orleans", where the Popeyes restaurants are all over the place and are cleaner than this dump.

If you go there...bring a gun with you.  you're stupid if you don't.  LOL  enjoy!
author: Cynthia B.

description:
Dont expect to get the deal. There was no free two piece meal with a purchase of a 3 pc dinner meal.

Lies and Deceit
author: Garrett W.

description:
I hope not all Popeyes in San Francisco is like this one. The food was horrible. It's so different from the Popeyes I've been to in Portland. I'd go to Popeyes any day over KFC (in Portland), but this Popeyes makes me wish I have gone to the KFC near my apartment instead.

The mashed potato was runny with chunks. The gravy was runny. The cajun rice was bland and pure nasty. The corn on the cob is 100% tasteless. I saw the employee pulled the corn out of a tray with corns soaked in water. :( No wonder all the flavor is gone.
author: Jennifer L.

description: I thought the chicken at Popeyes was very mediocre; I don't know what all the hype is about. I ordered three strips with a side of fries and a diet coke. The meal was decent and definitely greasy. The people working at Popeyes are some of the rudest people I have ever met here in San Francisco. I asked for ketchup and one of the cashiers barked at me then threw ketchup at me. The restaurant was pretty dirty (as others have pointed out) and the population it serves is a bit sketchy. I didn't see pigeons; I was looking very closely for them. I would advise coming before 12:30 as thats when the line starts to form out the door. I'm not coming back, sorry.
author: Tommy C.

description: The cashier has a bad ass attitude.  Always looks pissed off.  Avoid Vickie the cashier
author: A L.

description:
Always on point. Service was fast. Prices are great. Chicken is greasy. And I've also found that the staff normally will help you out with finding the best deal based on what you try to order. For example, if you want the 8 pieces of chicken, but the deal comes with the large side and biscuits, but you just want the chicken, it was suggested that I could get the 10 pieces for a better price, which was the special that was running at the time. 

Also, the regular deals are also amazing so go back often!
author: Andrew Y.

description:
Just like me... POPEYE's is one Baaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaad mutha! 
Not bad meaning bad, but BAAAAAAD meaning GOOOD!

I grew up in a KFC household... It was the Standard every Sunday as we watched the Niners be the team of the 80's ... eventually our local KFC started to deliver and accepted checks too!  Chicken pot pies and the spicy BBQ chicken wings were my basics... Then one day, my aunt came home with a bucket of POPEYE's chicken.... I was in awe... and never again has KFC graced our kitchens.  My mom was addicted and pretty soon we had chicken from POPEYE's at least once a week since 2004, yes ONLY 2004! My fam slept on this chicken joint THAT LONG! 

Fast Forward to 2009... POPEYE's started their 2 for 1 Tuesday special and my 98 year old grandma was hooked.  Every Tuesday she knows it's POPEYE's for lunch.  She asks for it BTW, we don't force feed her!

Personally, my favorite location to get my POPEYE's fix is in East Oakaland down Fruitvale Avenue - which is also the POPEYE's I turned Ashlee R. out on too fittingly after a trip to the 24 hour fitness in Alameda LOL! 

I'm all about the chicken when I order at POPEYE's!  My mouth salivates just thinking about that fried crispy skin.  My arteries explode in happiness just thinking of it's warming effect in my mouth... Crunch Crunch Crunch!   I love the mash/gravy here, I usually order it as my side so I can dip my chicken and biscuits in the gravy!  And OH THE BISCUITS - I truly believe that they are made of butter then deep fried in butter... YUM!

---- so this review is for the guy behind the counter this past Saturday @ this Divisadero location ---

I ordered a 3 piece chicken meal - Mild all Thighs
While he was putting my order together he realized there were no Mild/Thighs and asked me if Spicy was ok.  I agreed.  After trying to put together my Spicy/Thigh order, he then realized that there was only one thigh and asked me if he could substitute it with 2 breasts instead.  I agreed.  Deep down I almost hollered back to make it 1 Spicy/Thigh and 2 Mild/Breasts but I did not want to further complicate the matter....

I opened my POPEYE's Box and to my surprise he TOTALLY read my mind!  2 Mild/Breasts and 1 Spicy/Thigh...

I just didn't expect really attentive customer service at a POPEYE's let a lone the one on Divis! lol... I was a happy customer... after a hard morning's work of delivering food to homeless shelters with E and nursing my ridiculously painful HANGOVER - Thank You to the POPEYE'S guy that topped it all with excellent service!
author: Chrysantha C.

description: This place was awfully disgusting with Filth, trash on the tables, trash overfowing out of the trash bin, and some of the RUDEST service people I have ever encountered at a fast food restaurant. Well, maybe that is not true, because I don't eat out at fast food to remember that statement, so I will say the rudest people I have met in a very long time. My grandmother likes this place. She buys chicken in her motorized wheel chair and brings it to her brother who cannot get around as often as she is able. He suffers from dementia. But I went in here for here. After I ordered my chicken and paid the money to the rude staff, that is when I looked around and saw all the filth on the tables, floors, chairs and over flowing trash bin... it was digusting. It made me not really enjoy the chicken. So I pretended that I liked it, but I did tell my grandmother that I will open up a fast food chicken spot right next door to popeye's and have my location clean and better tasting food. Then I thought, well what if I just wrote  a letter to the store owner, maybe that will make a difference. So this is what I am doing. Don't be deceived. This place was gross, greasy and gut gaining! Do not patronize until the get there clealiness report from th city of San Francisco!
author: Nate C.

description: Has to be the best chicken in the city! I so prefer it over KFC.... I just went to the other location on Divisadero, and I have to say that the one on Fillmore/Webster is 10 times better.
author: Crystal P.

description: I  had lunch @ this Popeyes the other day . A wile later I got back home and felt this horrible pain in my belly it was terrible  I had to take pain meds and lay down in bed  with a heating pad .   Old chicken ? Beware ! The health department should give them a vist .     I will not be coming back  !
author: Matthew C.

description:
Just get the chicken and biscuits. Sides in a place like this are . . . close to inedible. I have no clue as to the cheese or cheese sauce that sticks to that mac - at least the salt seems low. The slaw needs to come with a strainer or a straw before it can be called slaw and not soup. Now, for the main reason you go to a Popeye's . . . chicken that is far better for take out than KFC. Just get the chicken . . . and maybe some biscuits.

To think I dropped three stars on this place?!?!? Stop using chicken legs smaller than most other place's chicken wings! YEESH!
author: Tristan C.

description: Came here a couple of times, I think their Tuesday special is still 99 cents, no self serve soda, but chicken is marinated right.
author: Da X.

description:
found a spot right out front today and got the chicken wrap.   the wrap was tasty and even though it was fast food, i enjoyed it.  it was wrapped up in some sort of corn-ish tortilla and was filled with some  fried chicken, bean-ish-thickish liquid and some rice.

the girls who worked the counter were not friendly at all.  i don't think they wanted to be there.
author: Amy L.

description:
I stopped coming here for awhile because:
1. Fried food isn't good for you.  Even 'tho I eat it at other places and fry at home.
2. The last time I tried the chicken, it tasted like it was cooked in rancid oil and the biscuits were hard, dry and tasted awful.
3. Parking does not exist on Divisadero Street. 

But, the Sunday paper enticed us today because Popeye's coupons were enclosed.  I was hesitant about going but since everyone wanted fried chicken,  we stopped for a combo with chicken (lots of wings), 2 sides of red beans/rice, 6 biscuits = $23, and an extra order of spicy fried shrimp w/Cajun fries, special at $5.  
I am glad we went today. Because, we found:
1. Parking.  Whoo-weeee.
2. The chicken was tasty, fried just right, flavorful and the red beans/rice was good and the biscuits were flaky and buttery.   The fried shrimp, altho' only 7-8 pieces were spicy and delicious and the fries reminded me of the curly fries served at Jack In The Box.  Who, by the way is in a coma as of Super Bowl after being struck by a bus. (www.HangInThereJack.com).
3. And yes, Virginia, there is a Santa Claus and fried food is still not good for you.  Moderation, honey, everything in moderation.
author: Ry T.

description:
In bad economic times, there is no better place for inexpensive fried chicken.  I love everything fried, so I think I know a thing or two about where to get the best fried chicken like it was the best fried crack.

8 Pieces with mashed potatoes and biscuits that's way better than any KFC's for under $15. 

Look, it's cheap, and it's pretty decent.  This isn't Maverick's!
author: Alfred Y.

description:
SO I just found out this place is only open till 10 pm, which tells me we really were drunk before 10 pm the last time I went. Shudder. I was with my date and we went for the $1 thigh and leg, but of course I was drunk and hungry and was duped by the smiling cashier into ordering meals. It cost $10.83 and it was hilarious.

Not complaining. I love Popeye's, or so I thought, until about two hours after ingestion I had to vomit. I could blame the whiskey, but I drink whiskey amost every night so I doubt this was the cause. I could blame the beers I consumed at bean bag, but I drink beer almost every night so this is highly unlikely. It was the chicken.
author: Y K.

description:
Forgot how good you were.  It's been such a long time and I've missed your crunchy texture and inner juicy plumpness.  I think about you at least once a day since we were reunited.  Even your breast were tender and juicy!  Will definitely not wait another 15 years till I visit you again.

Honey on biscuits are a delectable new discovery for me.
author: HY L.

description:
I issue a challenge to fried chicken connoisseurs that Popeyes just might be some of the best chicken in town. I've had my share of gourmet fried chicken and grew up on the Colonel's own special blend, but I'm starting to believe in Popeyes and their mighty tasty, mighty spiced variety. So crisp, yet so tender. What can I say, I'm a flavor seeker. 

I know it's not good for me, just like booze and Law & Order marathons, but sometimes you have to give into vice. Sometimes the good die young. What am I even talking about?

This location in particular (actually the only one I've been into) always beckons to me, especially when I'm carousing over at NOPA across the street. Especially after 5 or more drinks. 

If you're with company, go for the bucket. In any case, you can specifically ask for drumsticks, which amongst the fried chicken set, is golden. Get some mac 'n' cheese or mashed potatoes for a side. 

A quick note about the Popeyes biscuit: it's heaven sent. Eat it plain, dip it, or if you're feeling ambitious, break up pieces of your chicken and make a mini sandwich. 

I'll end with some fun trivia: The founder of this wonderful Louisiana-based chain has claimed that he named the establishment after the Detective Jimmy "Popeye" Doyle in The French Connection (not the sailor of the same name); he also wouldn't confirm or deny that he was too poor to afford an apostrophe. I like stories like this, but now must  go and eat some fried chicken.

Oh one more tip: If you're feeling embarrassed about going, tell people that you're fine dining at this new Southern-Latin fusion joint pronounced "Poe-pee-yes."
author: Nish N.

description:
Cravings are an interesting thing. They sneak up on you and bite you in the ass and before you know it you are like a 14 year old girl with her first crush on a guy who ends up never really liking her but then asks your friend to the prom and then they end up falling wildly in love with each other, making out with each other in front of you constantly and then you are totally heart broken and and and and. Wait, what was I talking about?

Oh yes! Cravings. Well, every once in awhile I crave fried chicken like a mo fo. It's right up there with the hot wings craving or the bay city deli sammich craving down in LA and when it hits, look out. So this week it was fried chicken and after trying to fulfill the yearn at Blue on Monday, I was still jonesing since their fried chicken isn't all that amazing.

Then Nish wrote a compelling review on this here Popeye's yesterday and kindly (evilly) sent it to me which really only fueled the craving fires and enough was enough, I needed savory relief and it was time for some mutha truckin Popeyes, yo!

Since we were hanging at his house, we opted to have me go pick some up and take it back to his pad. Odd right? Why wouldn't one want to dine in and stay awhile at such a fine establishment? (hehe) When I walked in, there was a line out the door. Clearly, I'm not the only one who craves this stuff. After about 10 minutes I got to the front and the craving fix was mere inches away. Oh the excitement. 

From there my piggy-like self ordered the 12 piece and 2 sides (Hey, that's not a lot for 2 people on a Tuesday, right?) and headed back to his house to nosh on plate fulls of wrong. 

Man I love being bad ;)
author: Stephy S.

description: This Divisadero location is one of the best in the city. Very nice staff,and fast. Hooray for hangover food:) Love dat chicken!
author: Shelley M.

description:
I'm not afraid anymore.  After noticing that Popeye's has received a total of three and a half stars, I know it is ok to confess my here-to-now secret love for Popeye's fried chicken.  

Back when I lived in this neighborhood I'd occasionally sneak out of my apartment cloak and dagger style to pick up some delicious Popeye's Fried Chicken.  I don't know why I was so ashamed to admit that I loved Popeye's - maybe it was the artery-clogging, weight-gaining, fried-food nature of the food; or maybe it was the nation-wide chain aspect of it; or maybe I just liked having a secret food obsession.  Whatever it was... I felt the need to be totally secret about my enjoyment of the Popeye's fried chicken (I personally prefer the all white meat chicken strips with two potato-based side dishes).  

Picture this:

It is May in the year 2003.  It is the dead of the night (i.e. 6:00 or 7:00 p.m.).  Matthew H. is sitting in his living room playing Metal Gear with his roommates.  Somewhere, deep in my sub-cockels I can feel the familiar stir of a Popeye's craving bubbling up through the depths of my being.  

Trying to remain casual so as to not alert my roommates to my dark-obsession, I stand up and stretch my arms.  A quick counter-clockwise head-roll, and then I fake a yawn.

Me:  "Hmmmm, I sure could use a cup of coffee.  I'm feeling pretty tired.  I think I'll go get a cup of coffee at Cafe Abir guys.  I'll be right back."

Roommate J to me: "Yeah.  Ok.  Whatever."

Roommate C to roommate J: "Dude, if you make Solid Snake smoke a cigarette you can see the red lasers and crawl under them to avoid detection by the guards."

With my roommates satisfactorily obsessed with their videogame, I know now is my time.  Rushing to my room, I throw on a large, unmarked hoodie, a baseball cap, and grab my backpack.  With this outfit I suspect I look generic enough to go unnoticed on my way to Popeye's.  

So as to avoid unwanted suspicion from my roommates if they were to have watched out the window - I walk away from Popeye's in the direction of Cafe Abir, and then double-back once I hit Divisadero.  Walking slowly and away from the street I try to remain casual.  Head down, hands in pockets - I make eye-contact with no one.  

I wander into Popeye's and quickly, look over both shoulders.  The coast is clear.   I was not detected.  

Me to Popeye's counter person:  "Breast strips with a side of mashed potatos and a side of potato wedges."  

When my order is ready, I reach deep into my pocket and produce correct change to cover my meal.  Quickly dropping the money on the counter, I open my backpack and put the Popeye's bag in.  

I sprint home, and quickly rush to my bedroom.  Only nano-seconds later, like a lean and hungry wolf, I devour my chicken and potato feast.  Scraps of breading are flying everywhere, gravy drips on my sweatshirt, deep gutteral gasps for air slip out in between bites.  

Then there is a knock on the door: 

Roommate J: "Matthew, are you in there?  What is all that noise?  Are you ok?"

Me:  "Nyum nyum.... everything.. nyum... is... nyum nyum... fine!!!  Go away!!!"

Roommate J: "Dude, are you sure?  The worst noises are coming out of there?  I'm coming in."

Me: "DUDE!!!!  nyum... nyum... NO!!!"

But it is too late.  He has opened the door.  Staring at me in a way that can only be described as either a) pure horror or b) utter indifference, my roomate says to me, "Dude, should have told me you were getting Popeye's.  I would have gone with you.  By the way, you should really chew with your mouth closed.  That is kinda gross."
author: Matthew H.

description:
This place makes KFC look "upscale". It's disgusting. In fact, I've been to a few over my lifetime and they where all the exact same... gross.

Here's a clue... they only open in "low income" areas. Kinda like liquor stores or check cashing places. Always ready to take advantage of the poor.

Do they even serve spinach?
author: Selino V.

description:
Popeye's chicken is tasty. At least momentarily. And while I cringe at the idea of how many nitrites are in the red beans and rice, they're even tastier...  But every time I get some inexplicable urge to put that garbage into my system, my body reacts violently. I wake up feeling like I'd just gotten a bowel prep before being admitted for surgery at St. Mary's.

I think my friend put it best: 'Popeye's is like a mild poison. You have to introduce it bit by bit to your body so you can build an immunity to it.'

Personally, I'd rather train for a marathon. And I hate running.
author: Omid T.

description:
Okay, so I am one of the last people who should be eating at these types of establishments being that I am a raging lush, smoker, don't excercise, and have a bag of pork rinds or jerky sitting next to my bed at all times-- but I figure since I'm on a roll I might as well enjoy my trashy foods before it all catches up to me and kills me by the time I'm 35.  I love Popeye's and my favorite is their cajun rice. Lord knows what the hell is in it, but as long as it tastes yummy I will continue eating it for the same reason I eat spam.  

I recently moved into the neighborhood and have managed to avoid getting my dinner there most nights of the week, but I finally broke down the other day when I got off the bus.  There was a massive line inside and I almost decided to ditch it but then I noticed the huge sign that said "99 cent Leg and Thigh Tuesdays Only!"  Holy crap, what a freakin' deal!  So I dealt with the line, got my special with a side of cajun rice, and quickly scuttled home to scarf down my meal. It was so delicious, but if my boyfriend knew I was eating it he would kill me so I threw away the evidence and had to eat a second dinner with him.
author: Jade L.

description:
The check out line:

O   "hey yo!"   O             O "what you want sweetie?"     O  O "Sum chicken  
|\                      |\             |\ o                                                 /|    /|\    bro?"          Q     
/\                      /\            /\  /\                                                  /\    /\                        

"She ghetto!".... - "Imma holla at you".
Now, dont mind.... focus on the FOOD! Just look straight up to the menu, get your food and go.
author: Cat of a Donut J.

description: the holiday cajun deep fried turkey is a home run, finally picked one up for $47 and change after tax, and my guests gobbled it up with seconds and thirds.  thxs, popeyes!
author: Pickle R.

description:
My tribute to a potluck usually involves fried chicken, and I knew Popeye's was on the way.  So, despite my previous experience, I decided to give it another shot.  

You see, one evening I did try the spicy chicken with jambalaya, and while I loved the jambalaya, the spicy chicken did some roto-rootering on me.  By the time I got home 30 minutes later I was suffering the misery that becomes comedy in some stand-up clubs.  So, today I decided to go with 8 mild pieces of chicken, and jambalaya for the side.  

Lessons learned:  
1.  mild fried chicken really is mild, easy on the digestive system 
2.  jambalaya and gumbo are two different things 
3. check to see how many sporks they give you.  I got ONE.  Like I'm going to eat all 8 pieces and the jambalaya by myself?  Oh, yeah.  I guess some people do.  
4.  chicken moves fast at a potluck.  It is a tasty premium next to the usual carbo fest.  
5.  fried chicken is all about the skin.  Fried chicken skin is mandatory!
author: David D.

description:
A haiku to Popeye's:

What is "No" "pa?"
Scoffs the crack ho, smelling not 
Of gentrification

I DEMAND my pieces
of fried mysterio-deliciousness 
I need not more
author: Jason S.

description:
You're welcome to hate on chains all you like; Most of the time it's justified. 

But if you don't love popeyes biscuits, frankly, you suck.

It's rough on your arteries, sure, but who can resist an occasional late night run into a dirty fast food joint for some deliciously greasy chicken, fake mashed potatoes, and those warm, doughy morsels of awesomeness? We all do it from time to time; We just don't talk about it.

Certain popeyes locations are halal; I don't think this one is though.

One more thing: You can go to popeyes.com, search for this location, and download a coupon with prominent spelling errors on it. Be sure to correct it with a red pen before redeeming it.
author: matthew r.

description:
About once a month a craving for fried chicken comes about. I suppose you could call it my "pollo period." There's no better place to satisfy this craving than Popeyes. 

They season and bread the chicken there (unlike some other restaurants. I wont name names but their initials are KFC)  and make the biscuits on site as well. Don't be mistaken, THIS SHIT WILL KILL YOU but at least it won't make you feel as sick as if you went to KFC. You know you're about to eat an extremely unhealthy meal when you think to yourself, "I should get some cole slaw just so that I have SOMETHING green."

The mac 'n cheese is kind of gross and the cole slaw will give you cavities it's so sweet. Mmmm.
author: Josua P.

description:
In a perfect world, this would be a Bojangles (anyone who has ever lived in the South knows what I'm talking about...or at least they should), but they haven't crossed the Mississippi OR the Mason-Dixon for that matter.

That said, Popeye's will suffice. I'm more privy to ordering up a spicy chicken sandwich, biscuit & seasoned fries to a 5-piece meal, but shit, who are we fooling here -- Popeye's is about as good as it gets when you're talking about friend chicken chain restaurants in Cali. So bring it on home.
author: Pete J.

description:
I missed Prince's Superbowl Halftime performance... because I got a call.... a telephone call today.  Somebody's having a child... 6 miles away.....

My cousin was in labor for 22 hours.  Finally, baby boy Isaiah arrived... all 6lbs and 14 ounces...19 and something inches long... and checkit: he's not an ugly baby.

What best way to welcome a new baby in the world, and to satisfy the hunger of all family members waiting for his arrival, but with a box of Popeye's Famous Fried Chicken?

The baby's paternal grandparents brought over a box, and I was fortunate to snag a breast piece.  Nope, no nipples, guys.  Just a perfectly fried, juicy, and flavorful fried chicken breast.

It was such a good piece of chicken that I almost forgot that I was watching the footage of the aftermath of childbirth on my cousin's lady bits on her digital camera.  Wow, this chicken was so good that I actually offered my new nephew some, but he was sleeping.  Oh wellz, MORE FOR ME!

I'm only giving this place 3 stars for now, as I was not actually able to review the location... just their product.  

Isaiah... you and I have an understanding, right?  I will see you in 6 months for your first ABC lessons in verbal and sign language.  Till then.... Welcome to the world where Fried Chicken is made.
author: Grace M.

description:
Fuckin' YUCK!

'nuff said.

....Well, maybe not.  If you look at their sign, it says "Pope Yes" notice it next time you go by, and you'll always see "Pope Yes" from then on.

Anyway, this is about my experience with Popeys Chicken.  Wrote a poem 'bout it.  Like ta hear it, here it go.... 

Tuesdays you can get a leg and thigh for a buck.  
Even at this price, I say fuckin' yuck
What is this shit  they expect me to eat?
There's more fat and batter than actual meat!
I just stood in line smelling yucky piss,
And the guy has the nerve to hand me THIS?
Smelly bums and crackheads all around,
There's no way I'm gonna choke this crap down.
And what the fuck is this biscuit-y thing anyway,
It tastes like margarine based paper mache.
Some people think Popeyes is the shit,
But I just threw up in my mouth a little bit.

*Edit:  I see that Popeys has a million positive reviews.  Hope I didn't offend anyone with my not so savory words.
author: Shawn S.

description:
Excuse me? What? A fat guy giving a five star review to Popeye's? No!! But Yes. The traditional reward for any time I make it to the gym for a week straight, or manage to avoid processed foods for a month is Popeye's The service is nonexistent (duh, it's a fast food restaurant). If there's a line of three people, it's completely possible to wait 20 minutes to place your order. 92.7 playing on the radio all day makes me feel like a candy raver, and the food quality is abysmal. But seriously folks - It's Fried Chicken and it isn't KFC!!! I love it so much! I always get the 3 piece combo with Mashed Potatoes and Gravy, and  a Root Beer. It's delicious - I undo all the damage that the gym did, and I feel like going into a coma for the next week. But Damn straight folks, this is as good as it gets. I love it, and I'll never leave it. Even if I went Vegan, Popeye's would be an exception. 
Cheers
author: Edwin M.

description:
If you live around Alamo Square, is there any place that is FASTER at taking care of your hunger?  No.  There isn't.  

Based on *taste*, it annihilates KFC.  Does that surprise anyone?  Who doesn't think that Popeye could stomp the Colonel in a fight?
author: Tim G.

description:
Mmmm, thank you for my piece of batter.

This place is dangerous cause it could become one of those cheap eats go-to habits.  But I have to say it turns me into a total snob because everytime I see it I think, "what and eyesore, can someone please take that away?  thanks."

I think it's funny that Popeye's and Nopa have to look at each other.
author: Dubs W.

description:
Oh god....

So i have fallen victim to Popeye's on two occasions. Both times, it was delicious while I ate it, but within the first 20 minutes after the meal, the immediate regret and stomach pains begin.  The overwhelming sense of "that was a bad idea" crosses my mind. 

"it is what it is,"  as the Real Popeye would say.

 If you need greasy hangover food, or are craving a little unhealthy comfort of fried chicken and want it cheap, then popeye's will fulfill that need. Unfortunately it will also fulfill an unwanted need to have to run home to your own toilet and camp out for a few hours. *bring a book.
author: Jimmy L.

description:
I stopped by the other day, because I was really hungry and we weren't going to have dinner until 9:00 p.m.  I had one bite of the chicken strip and I think my heart stopped - just for a moment, while my body tried to process the caloric intake of the deep-fried sin.

I remember reading that Popeye's is one of the few places that still uses animal lard. . . no crisco, no canola, no pennzoil sae-30, just pure animal blubber.

It's sad I became such a hater, I used to go to college out east and there was a Popeye's around the corner. . . rent was cheap. . . like $200 a month cheap, so I lived near the projects.  Wait a minute, I still live near the projects.  I have fond memories of Popeye, Bluto and Olive Oil.  I used to visit once every other week, but that was when Popeye seemed like less of a villian and more of a friend that helped you study in the wee hours of the night and gave you energy when you were down to your last two bucks.
author: E L.

description:
I always get ordering anxiety at Popeye's, mostly because I don't get there very often and I need to get my ENTIRE fix.  This last time I forgot (in order of importance): honey, jumbalaya, coleslaw (thanks RB), and ranch.

Regardless, Popeye's is absolutely delicious.  I find the vitriolic rants against gentrification, national fast food chains, jerkoffs and "your" mom to be missing the point.  Doesn't the fact we all like greasy fried chicken and will go across town to get it prove our connectivity?  Even If we do live in the Marina?  (Not that I do but still...)

Popeye's reigns supreme (over KFC, Church's ect.) because I know REAL live Southerners who go there and love it.  SO there.

You can also order a Thanksgiving turkey complete with sides and a pan of biscuits.  You're welcome.  WARNING: Do not visit the chain's website in a carb infused haze and click on that subversive little tab called "nutritional information".  Trust me and just don't...ignorance is bliss.
author: Amber B.

description:
ARGH!  I was saved from the Popeyes until I found myself walking in there and ordering a chicken biscuit!

NOO!  It was so perfect the first time.  Tender, sweet, innocent.  Like first love's first kiss.  Clumsy, eager, inexperienced, messy and with awkward crumbs everywhere.

Then the second time I was disappointed and it was not as good.  They gave me spicy tenders in the chicken biscuit.  Like the morning after.  But yes, I still ate 2 of them.  I'm not going to let food go to waste, children are starving down the street.
author: Christina C.

description:
Blah.

I walk by this and am reminded of the smell of Hooters, which was a scarring experience.

Not many places smell like deep fried asshole. I only give it 2 stars and not one because I have never eaten there, but am not sorry to say I never will. Some things, like battery acid, you know shouldnt be ingested.

Do yourself a favor and just walk away. I dont even really think they cook chicken. Animal 51? probably.

walk away.
author: Serene M.

description:
I don't care that it takes an hour to park every time I come here. Or that there are usually homeless people chilling inside and mumbling strange things to themselves. Or that each meal is 10,000,000 calories.

Popeye's will always have a very special place in my heart.
author: Don H.

description:
Because I live in San Francisco, and I don't know any better...(Real cajun/creole/soul food don't really exist out here)

And because when you're craving some of that Fried Chicken, and Red Beans and Rice at 11:30 pm....where do you turn to??? 

Definately not Denny's....Popeyes would be like 5 stars compared to that place.
author: clint t.

description:
My first time eating here, or any Popeye's at all, was on Sunday.

My my my....quite tasty.

See, I was raised on KFC. It was always there for me. While I still love KFC, I will admit that the breasts at Popeye's were much better. The rest of the pieces were smaller it seemed.

Also, the side dishes were DELICIOUS! Totally love them! I will say I was quite disappointed in their mac and cheese. They seriously screwed this up. It was just horrible.

If you go, stick with the mashed tatoes and gravy. SO GOOD!
author: Nicolas H.

description: I realize it is fast food but you can manage how much chicken you have sitting around, making biscuits fresh, and how you make your sides. The one on mission and 22 has a much better organization which results in higher quality fast food (oxymoronic I know).
author: Sun K.

description:
The fried chicken is good enough, worth three stars. I never eat KFC's chicken but I have had their mashed potatoes lately and Popeye's is way better. The KFC gravy has to be drained off because it's nazty, but that green chili gravy is good to the last glob.

The 99cent Tuesday deal is worth a star in itself. I got stuck with four thighs and no legs, but they were just spicy enough, juicy enough, and barely crispy enough to be good. Two specials and a side of mashed potatoes ran me $4.

Popeye's is not good enough to draw me back in regularly, but it's definitely worth the occasional Tuesday visit.
author: CrapulentMoose ..

description:
BEST CHICKEN EVER!

whenever i catch a show @ the justice league (now called the independent, but i will always call it "the old justice league"), i always buy a single drumstick from popeye's before or during the show. a total treat! mmm like a meat popsicle.
author: miss b.

description:
This is another of thos places that only exists one day out of the year.  New Years Day.  Any other day and just driving past this place makes me wanna hurl.  

New Years Day?  I already wanna hurl from the Black Tie Drinkathon we host every year, but long standing Embassy tradition means that the first person up fetches the Popeyes and we sit around in the dark of the living room in our pajamas (or slept in party cloths.  Whatever.) retracing/recreating/reenacting/wondering about the evening before.  

Ah yes.  Good times.

Any other day of the year they would get no stars.  None.  OK, maybe one, but jus because yelp would make me. Generally the people who work there are so irritable I feel like slapping them and have an IQ to fit the menu. ie 4, 12, 16 (peices).... However, I once got $16 in change  from a $10 when I bought lunch there.  I went ahead and kept it cause I also got yelled at.  That was when the New Years Day policy went into effect.
author: Cosmolicious L.

description:
I live in a city nearly completely devoid of soul food. Actually, yes, I think completely devoid of true, uncontaminated Southern home cooking. Well, I'm a Southern boy and I need my food. Sure, I can make it at home, but sometimes you just don't feel like it.

If I were back home, this place would get 3 - 4 stars, but in comparison with the rest of San Francisco, this place is miles ahead. SADLY ENOUGH. Popeye's is a third rate, ugly, stinky, (albeit pretty tasty for what it is) fast food version of my Mema's food. 

And God bless em, cause otherwise I'd have NOTHING.

(i wish the collards weren't always limited time only, and maybe a little corn bread can't hurt anyone. i know they claim to be cajun, but throw me a bone!)
author: Cameron O.

description:
Bomb fast food.  Great chicken and delicious sides.

And for all you yuppie assholes who think "its an eyesore for the divisco" move to the fucking marina where you belong. I hope you all get a chicken bone from Nopa caught in your throat or go into diabetic shock from eating too many sweets at Candybar.

Get the fuck out of my neighborhood!
author: sean k.

description: I do not recommend making a habit out of eating here, but we all know that maybe once a year some no-fuss fried chicken on the cheap is just the best thing ever.  And I think Popeye's is the place to get it.  Besides their spicy chicken tenders, I really appreciated how the guy helping me destroy my diet (and with a trip to Italy and swimsuits coming up no less) was actually hustling to get the food out quickly.
